Package com.zoho.arattai.Message

Class ImageMessage

java.lang.Object
com.zoho.arattai.core.Message
com.zoho.arattai.Message.ImageMessage
public class ImageMessage extends Message
Represents a photo or image attachment parsed from a WhatsApp chat export.

An ImageMessage is produced for any message whose attachment filename carries one of the following extensions: .jpg, .jpeg, .png, .gif, .bmp, or .webp (when the filename does not begin with the STK- sticker prefix â€” see StickerMessage for the sticker-specific sub-type).

Pixel dimensions (getImageWidth() / getImageHeight()) are extracted at parse time by decoding the image via javax.imageio.ImageIO directly from the ZIP entry stream. If decoding fails for any reason (unsupported format, corrupted data, etc.) the dimensions default to 0.

All fields are immutable (public final) and initialised at construction time.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Zoho Arattai
See Also:

    The horizontal dimension of the image in pixels, or 0 if unknown.

  • Constructor Details

    • ImageMessage

      public ImageMessage(String imageName, int imageHeight, int imageWidth, int imageSize, String imageType, String sender, Date timestamp, Message.MessageType messageType)
      Constructs a new ImageMessage with all metadata provided by the parser.
      Parameters:
      imageName - the image filename inside the ZIP; must not be null
      imageHeight - the image height in pixels (0 if undetectable)
      imageWidth - the image width in pixels (0 if undetectable)
      imageSize - the file size in bytes
      imageType - the lowercase file extension; must not be null
      sender - the display name of the sender; must not be null
      timestamp - the date and time the message was sent; must not be null
      messageType - the type classification; expected to be Message.MessageType.IMAGE
